HANCOCK DUNBAR, 366 acs. King &
Queen Co. on Asswaymanscock Sw, at
a Bridge & along the County Road to the
Fork of the old Mill Path; adj. John
Langham, Bagby, & Benjamin Pendleton
formerly Pens; 10 Jul 1767, p.6. for 2
Ibs. of Tobacco for every Acre of sd
Land Whereas by Inquisition indented
taken in King & Queen Co. 30 Jun 1764
by Virtue of a Warrant directed to Philip
Ludwell Esq. our Escheator for the sd
Co. It appears that William Major late of
the sd Co. at the Time of committing a
certain Murder of which he was
afterwards attainted was Seised of Land
supposed to contained 386 acs. in the sd
Co. But by a Survey thereof lately made
is found to contain only 366 acs. which
is found to Escheat to Us from the sd
William Major And Whereas John
Dixon, Clerk hath made humble Suit and
obtained a G. for the same (which he
hath Assigned to Hancock Dunbar).
